First, create a circle centered at (0.0375, 0.0375) with a radius of 0.0375 for loop 1 on face 1. Next, create a circle centered at the same point, but with a radius of 0.0321 for loop 2 on face 1. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.075. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using euler angles of [0, 0, 0] and a translation vector of [0, 0, 0]. Extrude the 3D sketch along the Z direction by 0.75 units. Part 2: Symmetrical Object with Two Cylindrical Components Construct a symmetrical object with two cylindrical components connected by a flat, rectangular surface. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles = [0, 0, -90] * Translation Vector = [0.0317, 0.0375, 0.0164] Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane. Create a circle centered at (0.0058, 0.5847) with a radius of 0.0058 for loop 1 on face 1. Create a circle centered at (0.0058, 0.6275) with a radius of 0.0058 for loop 1 on face 2. This part has four faces and each face has one loop. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.6333. Extrude the 3D sketch along the Z direction by 0.0214 units, creating a cut parallel to the XY plane, effectively removing material from the solid. Repeat the extrusion to create another parallel cut of the same depth. **Note:** The final shape has a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered end, standing upright. Part 1 contributes to the main body of the object, while part 2 adds a few truncated sections around the circumference, perfecting the tapered shape.
